com.here.sdk.mapviewlite

Class MapOverlay<T extends android.view.View>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.sdk.mapviewlite.MapOverlay<T>

  • public class MapOverlay<T extends android.view.View>
extends java.lang.Object
    A generic class that can be used to display Android views at a fixed location on the map. The overlay will automatically be repositioned on the screen as the map moves. There is slightly more performance overhead involved in positioning an overlay as compared to a map marker, so for use cases which only require static images, markers should be used.

      • setAnchorPoint

        public void setAnchorPoint(@NonNull
                           Anchor2D anchorPoint)
        Sets an anchor point for this instance. Normally the anchor point of a view is the top left corner of the view. It is from here that the view's position within the parent view is set. This anchor point can be altered by specifying a separate horizontal and vertical value. Due to differences in screen resolutions, this is not specified as a pixel value but is calculated from a floating point number between 0.0 and 1.0, with 0.0 representing the left or top of the view and 1.0 representing the right or bottom of the view. The default value used is 0.5, 0,5, causing the view to be centered.
        Parameters:
        anchorPoint - A Anchor2D relative to the top-left corner of the MapOverlay.

      • getAnchorPoint

        public Anchor2D getAnchorPoint()
        Returns the anchor point for this instance.
        Returns:
        The anchor point.
